alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Jackson; Mellette; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 03 at 2:37AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .DISCUSSION...Rain and some snow can be expected this morning over northwest SD, with scattered to isolated showers possible this afternoon from northwest SD to central SD. Gusty northwest winds can be expected today, especially from the Black Hills southeast. Northwest winds of 25 to 35 mph, with gusts over 50 mph will be common. Minimum relative humidity of 40 to 50 percent can be expected over northwest SD, with 25 to 35 percent over southern SD. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Monday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the very high category.
